div.head: An approved Ointment to cauſe a Beard.
div.p: Take of Oyl of ſweet Almonds, Myrrhe, each an ounce, the rine of the roots of Reeds burnt, Maidenhair burnt, each two drams, heads of Flies burnt, Bees bruiſed in their emptineſs, each half a dram, Labdanum two drams, Honey one ounce, powder them, and with a little Wax, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another for the ſame.
div.p:
Take the aſhes of a Mole dried in an oven, two ounces, the aſhes of Bees, of Filberds burnt, each one dram and a half, Mouſeturd two drams, Labdanum a dram and a half, the beſt Honey one ounce, Oyl of Nard, Wax, each a ſufficient quantity; make a Liniment, but in the morning following you muſt waſh your face with this Decoction: Take of Maidenhair, male Southernwood, Roſemary, Myrtle-leaves, the rine of Reed roots▪ Flowers of Chamemel, red Roſes, leaves of ſowre
Dock, each one handful, Pockwood half a pound, make a Decoction and uſe it as hath been ſaid.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Fenigreek ſix pints, Flax-ſeed three pints, Labdanum eight ounces, the Juice of binding Bean-tree two ounces, of the Indian leaf two ounces, twenty Gauls, Aromatical Onyx two ounces, Syrian Cane two ounces and a half, Bdellium two ounces, Myrtle burnt twenty four ounces, Musk three ounces, Florence Flower-de-luce two ounces, powder them ſeverally, ſearce them and mix them.

div.head: Another to cauſe Hair.
div.p: Take the aſhes of Graſhoppers burnt, of Bees burnt, Oyl of Myrtles or fat, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Of Ointments that hinder the growth of hair.
div.p: Take the Decoction of Spurge mixt with Vineger, unſlaked Lime and Mallows.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Gum of Ivy, Ants Eggs, yellow Arſnick, Colophony, each one ounce, Leeches burnt half an ounce, powder them and mix them with the blood of Frogs, and make an Ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take the blood of Bats, the Juice of Ivy,
the Juice of Radiſh, Goats Suet, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the fat of Frogs, of a Mole, a Bat, Gum of Ivy, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Opium, Henbane, each a ſufficient quantity, powder them, and with Vineger bring them into the form of an Unguent, with which anoint the hairs daily.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take a ſufficient quantity of Caſtor, ſcum'd Honey enough to make it into an ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take a whole Hedge-hog, boyl it in oyl till the fleſh be parted from the bones, ſtrein it, and with the aforeſaid oyl mix Ants Eggs, and anoint it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Hemlock-ſeed a ſufficient quantity, powder them, and with the blood of a Bat, bring them to the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take the Gum of Ivy one ounce, yellow Arſnick, Colophony, Hemlock-ſeed, each half an ounce, Caſtor two drams, Opium one dram, Henbane one dram and a half; Juice of Hemlock, the blood of a Bat, each a ſufficient
quantity, make an Ointment to annoint the bare places.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of the blood of a Bat, of mans blood, new Caſſia, each alike parts, Ants Eggs, Henbane-ſeed, black Poppy-ſeed, each alike parts, pouder what is fit, and mix with the reſt.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Cimolian earth, Ceruſſe, each one part, Roche-alume half a part, juice of Henbane a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of white Tartar pouder'd, ſcum'd Honey, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and anoint.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Gum of white Vine, Gum of Ivy, Bryony, pouder them and mix them with oyl into the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Ants Eggs, the blood of Frogs, the ruſt of Iron, mix them up with ſpittle.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Gaul of a Hedge-hog, the Gaul of a Co • morant, Sea-ſhells burnt and pouder'd, the blood of a Bat, each a ſufficient quantity; make an Ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the aſhes of Swallows burnt, the milk of Spurge, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Gum-arabick, Tragacanth, burnt Braſs, Verdigreaſe, Arſnick, Long-pepper, white, black Pepper, Blood-ſtone, Starch-corn, Dyers Madder, Scales of Braſs burnt, each two drams, Dragons blood, Juice of binding Bean-tree, each a dram and a half, Frankincenſe, Spike, burnt Gauls, each one dram, Sarcocol, Ammoniacum, diſſolved in Aquavitae, each half an ounce, pouder them and mix them with the Juice of Citrons or Lemmons, and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Henbane, Dragons blood, Gumarabick, white Frankincenſe, each ſix drams, Night-ſhade water a ſufficient quantity, pouder them and mix them to the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of burnt Dates two drams, Spike one dram and a half, pouder and mix them with Honey, and the turd of a Mole, to the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ruſt of Iron, Sea-ſhells burnt, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them with faſting ſpittle.

div.head: An Ointment to make the Hair ſhed, and grow no more.
div.p:
Take of yellow Arſnick, Ants Eggs, Gumarabick,
each half an ounce, Gum of Ivy two ounces; with the blood of a Bat, or Juice of Henbane, make an Unguent, apply it, the hairs being firſt cut.

div.head: Of Ointments that take away the hair.
div.p: Take of gold coloured Arſnick, ſeven or ten ſcruples, unſlaked Lime the ſame quantity, Starch-corn two ounces, Selinuſian earth an ounce, powder them and fine ſearſe them; when you would uſe it, take a ſufficient quantity and ſhake it together with water, then lay it on, and ſee that it burn not.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take two parts of unſlaked Lime, yellow Arſnick, one part, put them into a leaden morter, and powder them with water or the juice of Ptiſan poured to them, and when they are black, command them to be laid on hot, eſpecially in a Bath.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Sandarach one dram, unſlaked Lime, eighteen ounces, pounder them and boyl them carefully with water, and when they begin to boyl, take it off and uſe it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Starch-corn, unſlaked Lime, yellow Arſnick, each one ounce, pouder, ſearſe them and lay them by, and uſe them as hath been ſaid.

div.head: Another that preſently takes away the hair by the roots.
div.p: Take of unſlaked Lime, Cimolian earth, a burnt Pummy-ſtone, each eighteen ounces, yellow Arſnick three ounces, pouder them and lay them by; when you have occaſion to uſe them, dilute them with water, and ſo uſe it.

div.head: Another to take away the Hair, and thin the Skin.
div.p: Take the juice of the leaves of wilde Cowcumber, milk of Almonds, unſlaked Lime, yellow Arſnick, Galbanum ſteept in Wine, and ſtreined, each a ſufficient quantity; when they are boyled, adde to them Oyl of Roſes, Maſtick, each a ſufficient quantity; Frankincenſe, the Gumm of Juniper-tree, Roſes, Cloves, Cummin, Nutmeg, Cynamon, each a little, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of the aſhes of Maſt-tree, two parts, yellow Arſnick one part, boyl them in River water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of black Soap one pound, Tartar, one ounce and a half, yellow Arſnick ſix ounces, juice of Cyperus fifteen drams, unſlaked Lime half an ounce, capital Lees one ounce, put the Lime in the Lees, ſtrein it, and mix it with the reſt.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Gum of Ivy two ounces, yellow Arſnick, Ants Eggs, Gum-arabick, each three drams, pouder them and mix them with ſtrong Vineger.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of yellow Arſnick three ounces, unſlaked Lime one dram, ſtrong Lye a ſufficient quantity, boyl them till the feathers come off, a quill dipt in it.

div.head: Another to take hair off the face.
div.p: Take of Colophony two ounces, Maſtick, Ammoniacum cleanſed, each one ounce, diſſolve them in a clean earthen veſſel, and ſtre • n it upon cold water, take it and work it together, and diſſolve a little of it over the fire, and apply it warm, letting it lye on for two hours, and then take it away.

div.head: Another to take away the hair.
div.p: Take of the powder of an Owl one ounce, Cummin, the blood of a Bat, each three ounces, Musk one ſcruple, make a Liniment: we muſt have a ſpecial care that the part to which the Ointment muſt be applied, be firſt waſhed with the Lye made of Vine aſhes, and if an itching be left in the part after application of the Medicine, anoint it with Rhaſes, white Ointment, or with the Decoction of Henbane-ſeeds, or of Colewort-ſeeds.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the blood of a Tortoiſe, of Frogs, of a Bat, Ants Eggs, red Ar • nick, Gum of Ivy, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them with Vineger, and anoint it diſcreetly, that it do not excoriate.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of yellow Arſnick, Juice of Henbane, each alike parts, mix them and anoint the part.

div.head: An Ointment to take away hairs from any part of the Body.
div.p: Take three whites of Eggs bruiſed, unſlaked Lime eight ounces, yellow Arſnick one ounce, a ſufficient quantity of Lye, make an Unguent, with which beſmearing a feather, anoint the hairy parts, but when they have been anointed a quarter of an hour, waſh off the Unguent with warm water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Ants Eggs, Juice of Henbane, Hemlock, ſeeds of Fleawort, the blood of a Bat, of a Tortoiſe, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and anoint the place: others run over the place with a plate of Gold red hot, ſo that no Doun any more appear.

div.head: Of Ointments that colour the Hair.
To make the Hair yellow.
div.p: RAw Lupines laid on with water and Niter, do make the Hair yellow.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the middle Bark of Elder, Flowers of Broom, Saffron, yelks of Eggs, each a ſufficient quantity, boyl them in water, and gather that which ſwims a top, and ſo anoint the hair.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of white Tartar burnt, Oyl of Acorns, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent, with which anoint the haires in the ſun, by combing.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Myrrhe one ounce, white Salt half an ounce, pouder and mix them with Oyl of Acorns into the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Flowers of Mullein one handful, Fenigreek two ounces, Vine aſhes, and of the wood of Ivy, each one handful, ten pints of water, boyl them all till one half be conſumed, ſtrein it, and add of the whiteſt Soap three pound, Saffron two drams, leave them ſo in the ſun for a moneth, mixing them every day with a ſtick; with this anoint the hairs in the ſun.

div.head: A Liniment to clarifie and whiten the Hair.
div.p: Take of Swallows dung, the roots of Elecampane, Radiſh-ſeeds, Brimſtone, flowers of Capers, Frankincenſe, each half an ounce, incorporate them all together with the like quantity of the Gaul or a white Ox; rub the hairs with it, being firſt waſht with the Lye of Vines, and dried, and while the haires are dried of their own accord after the Lotion, rubbing them, waſh them again in the ſame Lye, and dry them by degrees with a hot cloth.

div.head: Of Ointments that dye the hair black.
div.p: Take of the ſcum of ſilver, Limolian earth, liquid Alume, each alike parts, the haires being firſt waſht and dried, anoint them over night, and binde over them Beets leaves.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Selinuſian earth, ſcum of ſilver, Lime, each alike parts, reduce them with water to the thickneſs of Honey, and when you have firſt waſht the hairs with a Lye, then anoint them; and likewiſe laying on the leaves of Beets, binde them up, and in the morning comb them out.

div.head: Ano • her to black the Beard.
div.p:
Dried and burnt Lead mixt with the juice of crude Beets, to the thickneſs of Honey,
laid on, and let alone till dinner time, then waſht off.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Gauls, Frankincenſe, Gith, each two drams, pouder them and put them in a Quince hollowed, cloſe it up, and wrap it in Bread-paſte, and bake it in an oven, till it is burnt, pouder it and mix the aſhes with oyl.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Gauls burnt with common oyl, two ounces, Roche-alume two drams, ſalt Gem one dram, with Oyl of Coſtmary make an Ointment.

div.head: A Liniment that will make gray Hairs black.
div.p: Take of Black, Emblick, Myrobalanes, Gauls, each twenty, Labdanum a ſufficient quantity, Leaves and Berries of Myrtle, each threeſcore, pouder and ſearſe them, and infuſe them in three pints of Oyl for three days, then boyl them till they grow thick, and anoint the roots of the hair with it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of the droſs of Iron, filing of Lead, each a ſufficient quantity, boyl them in Vineger till one half be conſumed, ſtrein it an anoint the parts: an unction of burnt Lead made with the juice of Beets to the conſiſtence of honey, will make the Beard black.

div.head: Of Ointments that dy the hair white.
div.p: Take of Swallows dung, the Gaul of a Bull, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Elecampane, the rine of Radiſh-root, Alume, Glew, each one part, mix them and anoint.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Swallowes dung, Radiſh-ſeed, Brimſtone, the bark of Caper-roots, a Cows Gaul, the beſt Vineger, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment to colour the hair red.
div.p: Take of burnt Tartar pouder'd, Oyl of wilde Cucumber, each a ſufficient quantity, make a Liniment to anoint the hair.

div.head: Of Ointments to curl the hair.
div.p: Take a ſufficient quantity of Rams horns, cut it and pouder it with Oyl, and anoint the hair.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of the root of Danewort, and pouder it with Oyl, then anoint the head, and binde leaves of the ſame over it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the juice of Beets, of Myrtles, common Oyl, each a ſufficient quantity, mix and anoint.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Pine-kernels burnt and pouder'd, Oyl of Myrtles, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of the ſcum of Salt, which is gathered in boyling, Myrrhe pouder'd, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Myrrhe, Gum-arabick, Oyl of Fenigreek, Oyl of Henbane, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Ointment for the hair.

div.head: Of Ointments to take away the faults of the Eye-brows.
For the falling of the hair off the Eye-brows.
div.p: TAke of the filings of Lead, of Drakes fat, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Filberds roſted and pouder'd, the fat of a Goat or Bear, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them to an Ointment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ſeeds of black Henbane two drams, Maidenhair one dram Ointment of Flower-de-luce three ſpoonfuls, pouder and mix them to the form of an Ointment.

div.head: An Ointment to make the hair of the Eyebrows grow again.
div.p: Take of Henbane-ſeed burnt, a ſufficient quantity, with water make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Bees burnt and pounder'd, a ſufficient quantity, and with Oyl make a Liniment for the Eye-brows.

div.head: An Ointment for Lice in the Eye-brows.
div.p: Take the yelk of an Egg boyled hard, a little Aloes, mix them and anoint.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Quickſilver killed with ſpittle, Stavesacer, each half an ounce, butter a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take one Apple roaſted and cleanſed, Quickſilver killed with ſpittle, a ſufficient quantity, mix them well and anoint.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Stavesacer one ounce, Oyl of Wormwood two ounces, Wax a ſufficient quantity, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Sugar'd-alume, Aloes, Staveſacer, Vineger of Squills, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Ointment.

div.head: Of Ointments that take away the black and blewneſs of the Eye-lids and Eyes.
div.p: Take of Beans husked and pouder'd, a ſufficient quantity, Honey what is convenient, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take a ſufficient quantity of yelks of Eggs boyled hard, Honey what is convenient, and beat them together to the form of an Ointment, with which anoint the parts.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Ceruſſe, Cummin, Bean, each a ſufficient quantity, pouder them, and with the juice of Coriander make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for the ſhedding of the hairs of the Eye-lids.
div.p: Take of Stibium burnt, and quencht in womans milk thirteen drams, Aloes, Myrrhe, Spikenard, each two drams, burnt Barley half an ounce, pouder them and mix them with a ſufficient quantity of water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Marrow of the right leg of an Ox, of Sut, each a ſufficient quantity, and mix them.

div.head: For the ſhedding of the Eye-brows and Beard.
div.p: Take of Henbane two drams, Mouſeturd one dram, Maidenhair two drams, Oyl of Flower-de-luce a ſufficient quantity, pouder and mix them with the Oyl, foment the part and then anoint it.

div.head: An Ointment for dropping of the Eyes.
div.p: Take of Myrrhe, Cummin, Frankincenſe, Maſtick, Ammoniacum, Bolearmenick, each half an ounce, Saffron 2 drams, pouder them all and mix them with the whites of Eggs, and lay them on the forehead and tempels.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of Frankincenſe, Maſtick, Gum-arabick, Tragacanth, Bolearmenick, Tutty, Dragons blood, each half an ounce, pouder and mix them with the whites of Eggs, and apply them to to the forehead and tempels.

div.head: Ointments to ſtop droppings of the Eyes.
div.p:
Take of Celandine, Rue, Vervin, the bark of Fennel-roots, each one handful, bruiſe them, and make a paſte with old Hogsgreaſe, which boyl in white Wine till the wine be almoſt conſumed, ſtrein it, and adde
new white Wax, Aloes, each three drams; Verdegreaſe, Saffron, each one dram, Frankincenſe three drams, Maſtick four drams, Camphure one dram, make an Ointment to anoint the eyes.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of Aloes, Sarcocol, Frankincenſe, each a ſufficient quantity, pouden and mix them with the Juice of Fennel.

div.head: An Ointment for tears of the Eyes.
div.p: Take of Tutty prepared Sarcocol, Myrrhe, Frankincenſe, Styrax-calamite, Ambergreece, each one ſcruple; dried Roſes, Sumach, Dragons blood, each ſix drams, pouder them, and with the mucilage of Gumtragacan • n and Arabick make an Ointment, of which put a little in the eyes.

div.head: An Ointment for red Eyes.
div.p: Take of Cummin poude • 'd, a ſufficient quantity, mix it with Wax, and lay it on the eyes when they are aſleep.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of Tragacanth, Gum-arabick, Roſes pouder'd, Starch-corn, Ceruſſe, each two ounces, Opium one ſcruple, pouder them and mix them with womans milk.

div.head: Of Ointments that cure the faults of the skin of the Head.
For Running-ſores of the Head.
div.p: TAke of Ceruſſe ſix drams, ſcum of Silver half a dram, Brimſtone ſix drams, Oyl of Roſes or Myrtles, Wax a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ſcum of Silver one dram, tender leaves of Rue, five and twenty drams, Vineger, Oyl of Roſes or Myrtles, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and anoint with a feather.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of burnt Ce • uſſe, Rue, Manna, Frankincenſe, each a hundred drams, Bark of Pine-tree fifty drams, Oyl of Myrtles three pints, and as much Vineger, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of the filings of Lead, Vine-branches, Frankincenſe, Myrrhe, ſcum of Niter, each fifty drams, Oyl of Myrtles, Vineger as much as is ſufficient, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment of Queen Cleopatra's for the ſame.
div.p:
Take of rub'd Ceruſſe, Frankincenſe, each
two drams, brimſtone one dram, powder them and with Oyl lay them on.

div.head: Another for Sores and Dander.
div.p: Take of Niter Copperas, each one dram, Oyl a ſufficient quantity, powder and mix them.

div.head: Another of Cleopatra's.
div.p: Take of live Sulphur ſix drams, male Frankincenſe, cleft Allom, wilde Staveſacer, rocket, ſcum of Niter, Copperas, each one dram, three forigs of Rue, Oyl of Bayes or Myrtels, Vineger, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of live Sulphur, ſcum of Silver, Ceruſſe, each alike part, Saffron half ſo much, powder them and uſe them with Candy wine.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take ſcum of Silver, unſlaked Lime, each twenty five drams, Vinegar or Oyl, three parts of a pint, powder and mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Copperas two drams, Sandarach half an ounce, ſcum of Silver one dram, Oyl of Myrtels, Vinegar, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another for Sores and Worms.
div.p:
Take of juice of Beets, of Celandine, Hogsgreaſe, each two ounces, white Hellebore
two ounces two drams, mix them and make an Ointment.

div.head: Another for Worms and Scabs.
div.p: Take of white and black Hellebore, live Sulphure, yellow Arſnick, Litharge, unſlaked Lime, Vitriol, Alume, Gauls, Sut, each half an ounce, Quick-ſilver killed, Verdegreaſe, each two drams, juice of Fumitory, Oyl, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another for Worms.
div.p: Take of Fenigreek one pound, Dragons blood pouder'd, one ounce, Pummy-ſtone one pound, Turpentine five ounces, Honey one ounce, four yelks of Eggs, Oyl of Roſes two ounces, mix them and make an Unguent; which uſe, the head being firſt ſhaved, and waſht with a childes urine, and cleanſed with a ſpunge, and anointed over with Oyl of Flax-ſeed.

div.head: Another for the ſame.
div.p: Take of Celandine three parts, Sowesgreaſe as much, white Hellebore one part, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for ſcurf in childrens Heads.
div.p: Take of Myrrhe, Orrice-root, black Hellebore, Oyl of Eggs, each a ſufficient quantity, powder them and mix them into the form of an Unguent, alſo Oyl of Bread-corn is good.

div.head: For Dander in the Head.
div.p: Take flour of Vetches, Fenigreek, Niter, Bran, Myrtles, Muſtard-ſeed, each fifteen drams, common Oyl▪ as much as is ſufficient, Vineger, Water, each a little, make an Unguent, with which anoint the head, firſt waſht and ſhaved.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take ſcum of Niter, Copperas, each alike parts, wine a ſufficient quantity, mix them & rub the head three o • four times a moneth.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Lee • of Wine, a Pummy ſtone, Niter, Lupines, each one part, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Cimolian earth, the Gaul of an Ox or Sow, Vineger, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for Lice.
div.p: Take of Stavesacer two parts, Sandarach, Niter, each one part; Oyl, Vineger each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of white Hellebore, Stavesacer, Niter, each alike parts; Oyl a ſufficient quantity, mix them, and apply them in a Bath.

div.head: An Ointment for Lice and Nits.
div.p:
Take of Stavesacer, Quickſilver killed
with ſpittle, each three drams, common Oyl three ounces, Wax one ounce, make an Unguent, with which anoint the head in ſtead of Soap, when it is waſht.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Sandarach, Niter, each one dram, Stavesacer two drams; Oyl, Vineger, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Bays, Radiſh-ſeeds, each two drams; Pepper, Saffron, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for red Specks in the face.
div.p: Take the roots of Dock, Sows-greaſe, each two ounces, white wax one ounce, melt them and adde Quickſilver kill'd, Camphure, each a little; Juice of Wormwood, Honey, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another for a red face.
div.p: Take of live Sulphur, yellow Arſnick, Turky Soap, each half a dram, Sut two drams, mix them.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take the Juice of ſeven Oranges, Juice of Night-ſhade, water of Water-lillies, Snail-water, each two drams, white Wax half an ounce, the fat of a Hen, and a Ram, each one ounce and a half, the green roots of _____ two drams, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for Wrinckles and Pimples of the Face.
div.p: Mix the Gaul of a Goat with the flour of Lupines, and at night rub the face.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of white Curral half an ounce, ſalt Gem, Ceruſſe, Camphure, each two drams, white Wax one dram, Roſe-water an ounce, the fat of a Hen waſht, two ounces, pouder and mix them for your uſe.

div.head: Another for Pimples.
div.p: Take of white wax one pound, oyl of violets one ounce, Quickſilver half an ounce, Maſtick one dram and a half, a little Camphure, Litharge one dram, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another for Biles or Botches.
div.p: Take the flour of Lupines, Beans, white Vetches, everlaſting Peaſe, each two drams, flour of Barley, of Lentils, each one dram, Radiſh-ſeed, Tragacanth, Starch-corn, each half a dram; Melon-ſeeds husked three drams, Saffron half a ſcruple, pouder them and work them with womans milk, at night anoint the face, and in the morning waſh it with the water of the rines of Melons and Violets.

div.head: An Ointment that takes away all Bunchings and Speckles of tho Face.
div.p: Take of the roots of Aſs-cowcumber, white Been, Bryony, Lupines, each half an ounce, Ceruſſe, Litharge, Tartar, each one dram; Cane-roots, Serapine, Pigeons dung, each two ſcruples, Oyl of Turky-millet three ounces, Oyl of Juniper, Oyl of Bread-corn, each two ounces and a half; Juice of Orenges four ounces, pouder what is to be pouder'd, and fine ſearſe them, then boyl them all till the Juice is conſumed, then take them from the fire, alwayes ſtirring them with a ſpattle till they are cold, then add the white of one new laid Egg beaten and ſtreined; Camphure pouder'd one dram, always mixing them, then waſh it in one pint of water, preſt from yong Canes, waſhing it ten times in that water, and ſtirring it with a ſpattle, and it is excellent.

div.head: For Botches and Worms of the Face.
div.p: Take of Hens fat, Betony, each as much as is ſufficient, mix them and beat them together.

div.head: An Ointment to whiten Skars.
div.p: Take of Oyl of Tartar, ſeeds of Fleawort, each one ounce, infuſe them in the mucilage of Borax, or ſalt Gem diſſolved in Oyl of Roſes, an ounce.

div.head: A Liniment for high red Skars.
div.p: Take Oyl of Litharge two drams, Oyl of Tartar, Balſom of Saturn, each one dram, camphure one ſcruple, Spermacety one dram, Oyl of Eggs two ounces, mix them and make a liniment, uſe it four times a day; the richer ſort may uſe Oyl of Talc, which is moſt excellent for all blemiſhes.

div.head: An Ointment to take away the thickneſs of the face.
div.p: Take of freſh Butter, Turpentine, each one ounce, Lilly roots roaſted in the leaves of Beets under the aſhes, three ounces unſlaked Lime five times waſht in Roſe-water, or the juice of Balm, freſh Hogs-greaſe melted in Roſe-water, each one ounce, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another for the tenderer ſort.
div.p: Take of Lilly roots roſted under the aſhes one pound, bruiſe them in a morter, to which adde Sugar-Candy three ounces, make an Ointment to apply to the face.

div.head: An Ointment for Warts in the face.
div.p: Take of Athenian Honey, the ſharpeſt Vinegar, each twelve drams, mix them carefully and anoint them, rubbing them with the fingers.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take the ſcum of Quickſilver three drams, pure Turpentine the quantity of an Egyptian bean, a little Oyl; mix them, and when you have cleanſed the face, take a little on your finger, then bruiſe it well, and anoint them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Allom cut and well pouder'd, Turpentine, each as much as it ſufficient, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Indian Coſtus bruiſed and ſearſed, a Goats Gaul, each a ſufficient quantity, make an ointment, with which anoint them towards night, and in the morning waſh the face with milk.

div.head: An Ointment for Ringworms in the face.
div.p: Take of Vineger of Squills two ounces, Aloes, the Juice of ſowre Dock, Oyl of Tartar, each three drams, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the diſtilled water of ſowr Dock four ounces, Borax three drams, common Salt one dram, Vineger of Squills one ounce, mix them, and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take Dock-roots three ounces, roaſt them under the aſhes, afterwards with Vineger
of Squills make a Liniment; if this cure not, adde of Quickſilver half a dram, or Sublimate one ſcruple; waſh the face often with the water of Myrtles, or of Roſe-ſeeds, afterwards adde alſo a little white of an Egg, that the skin may reſiſt it the better.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Tartar two drams, pouder it and apply it with the whites of Eggs, or with three drams of burnt Alume do the like.

div.head: An Ointment for callous Warts.
div.p: Take of French Soap half an ounce, Ammoniacum, Styrax, Frankincenſe, each one dram, diſſolve them in water and make it to the thickneſs of a Cerot, then anoint with it, and after one hour, waſh it off with warm water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of red Niter, Hyſſope, Pennyroyal, Salt digged up, each equal parts, beat them and ſearſe them, make it up with Cerot of Roſes, and uſe it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ſeeds of Baſtil, red Niter, green Pennyroyal, cleft Alume, Indian Coſtus, each alike parts, pouder and ſearſe them, and mix them with a ſufficient quantity of Goat, or Hens-greaſe, to the form of an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of burnt Salt, Pennyroyal, Hyſſope, Ammoniacum, Sumach, each equal parts, oyl of Roſes as much as is ſufficient, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for Ringworms of the face.
div.p: Take of Aloes two drams, diſſolve it in Vineger of Squills to the form of a Liniment, anoint the parts affected at night.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the roots of Bryony, as many as are ſufficient, work them up with ſalt in the ſharpeſt Vineger, and apply it.

div.head: Another approved one.
div.p: Take of ſharp Dock two parts, Gentian one part, boyl them in water, then ſtrein them, and mixing it with Calves-greaſe, boyl it again with a ſlow fire, to the conſiſtence of an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for Surn-burns, Clefts of the Lips, and Speckles in the Face.
div.p: Take twenty Snailes with their ſhells, bruiſe them, then adde the weight of them in Ceruſſe, new Wax three ounces, Hartshorn one ounce, make a Liniment, then waſh the face.

div.head: An Ointment for Warts in the Face.
div.p: Take the roots of Aſarabacca, temper them in Roſe-water two dayes, bake them and anoint the part.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the roots of Celandine, as much as is ſufficient pouder'd, mixt with greaſe and applied, it waſtes and takes them away.

div.head: For a red Face.
div.p: Take Brimſtone one ounce, Ceruſſe waſht two drams, Juice of Lemmons one ounce, apply it at night with the Decoction of Bran.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Tartar, Oyl of Roſes, Juice of ſowr Dock, of Bays, of Graſs-plantane, each four ounces, Ceruſſe one ounce and a half, Litharge of Gold two drams, Quickſilver killed one ounce and a half, roots of Aſphodel burnt under the aſhes two ounces, make a Liniment in a leaden morter.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Citrine ointment half a pound, Litharge four ounces, Ceruſſe waſht two ounces, Cotton, Alume burnt, Tartar calcined, each one ounce and a half, the Juice of Elecampane roots, the Juice of ſowr Dock, Sowsbread, Lemons, each five ounces, Camphure three drams, oyl of Roſes a pound and a half, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Juice of Fumitory, Plantane, Sorrel, each three ounces, Oyl of Roſes one ounce, Gum-tragacanth, Arabick, each half a dram, Dragons blood two drams, new Wax as much as is ſufficient, make an Ointment to uſe going to bed, and the next day waſh with the Decoction of Beans.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Litharge twice or thrice infuſed in Vineger, one ounce, nouriſh it with white Wine and Goard-ſeed, and ſtir it till it be brought to the form of an Unguent, adde of Camphure diſſolved in Roſe-water half an ounce, anoint the face, and in the morn waſh it with the Decoction of Beans.

div.head: A Liniment for a ſcabby face.
div.p: Take of Litharge of Gold one ounce and a half, Ceruſſe waſht in Plantane-water, and Horſe-tail two ounces, Oyl of Roſes three ounces, boyl the Oyl, and with white Wax make a Liniment.

div.head: For redneſs and bunchings in the face.
div.p:
Take Oyl of Roſes, Oyl of Tartar, each four ounces, juice of Wood-ſorrel three ounces, Ceruſſe waſht one dram and a half, Litharge of Gold two ounces, Quickſilver killed one ounce and a half, roots of Aſphodel
burnt under the aſhes, make a Liniment in a leaden morter.

div.head: For leprous Faces.
div.p: Take the powders of Citrine-ungent, Litharge of Gold, each four ounces, Ceruſſe waſht two ounces, Borax, Alume burnt, Tartar calcined, each one ounce and a half, the juice of Elecampane-roots, of ſowre Dock, Sows-bread, Lemmons, each five ounces, oyl of Roſes one pound, Quickſilver kill'd with ſpittle four ounces; make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the aſhes of the root of Birthwort, Graſs-plantane the fine taken off and waſht nine days in ſpring-water, then ſearſe it all, and take what you pleaſe, and diſſolve it in Plantane, or Purſlane-water, and anoint the face.

div.head: An Ointment for Knobs appearing under the Skin.
div.p: Take the roots of Saffron, mix them with womans milk, and apply it.

div.head: An Ointment for Surn-burns.
div.p: Take Juice of Plantane, Night-ſhade, each one dram and a half, Litharge of Gold, of Silver, each one dram, burnt Lead an ounce, Tutty prepared ſix drams, Camphure half a dram, oyl of Roſes, Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointments for Ringworms.
div.p: Take of Vitriol, Frankincenſe, Myrrhe, cleft Alume, each one ounce; Aloes, live Sulphur, each half an ounce, make it up with wine to a convenient thickneſs, and twice or thrice a day anoint the parts firſt rubbed.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Vitriol half an ounce, Juice of binding Bean-tree two drams, ſcales of Braſs half an ounce, live Sulphur ſix drams, white Vitriol, Gum each one ounce, Vineger, as much as is ſufficient, in which when you have diſſolv'd the Gum and mixt the other things, adde the Lees of Oyl.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of live Brimſtone, Frankincenſe, Myrrhe; Copperas, raw Vitriol, each two drams, Gum half an ounce; Vineger, Oyl of Cedar, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take the Gum of Ethiopian-olive, five and twenty drams, Gum forty drams, Copperas ſixteen drams, live Brimſtone, Frankincenſe, ruſt of Braſs, the Juice of binding Bean-tree, white Myrrhe, each ten drams, Vineger as much as is ſufficient, when they
are all diſſolved, mix them up with thick Lees of Oyl.

div.head: An Ointment for old Tetters.
div.p: Take of Copperas, Fenigreek mollified, Cardamoms, each two drams, Gith, Figtree leaves, each one dram and a half, the ſharpeſt Vineger, as much as is ſufficient, powder them, and bring them to the thickneſs of Honey.

div.head: An Ointment for Burns.
div.p: Take Oyl of Roſes, Roſe-water, whites of Eggs, each a ſufficient quantity; mix them, and for four days apply them to the burnt place, the fifth day lay on the following plaſter: Take of Oyl of Nuts, new Wax, each one ounce, melt them together.

div.head: An Ointment for Scalds and Burns.
div.p: Take of the middle barke of Elder, ſix drams, Oyl of Roſes one ounce and a half, Maſtick, Frankincenſe, each half a dram, white Wax, two ounces, boyl them in four pints of water till one half be waſted, ſcum'd, and cooled, that which ſwims a top is fit to apply to the burn.

div.head: Another for a Burn.
div.p:
Take of the juice of Night-ſhade, Plantane, each two ounces, the middle bark of Elder, Oyl, each one ounce, boyl them in a
double veſſel till the juices be waſted, then add Ceruſſe waſht in Roſe-water, Litharge of Gold, each a dram and a half, Tutty prepared, three drams; the bark of Frankincenſe two drams, freſh Hogs-greaſe w • ſht in Roſe-water, ten drams, white Wax as much as is ſufficient, make a Liniment; towards the end adde three whites of Eggs, Camphure half a dram.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of new Lime waſht in Roſe-water, three pound, Juice of Roſes, Juice of Plantane, each two pound, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Roſes two ounces, Oyl preſt from Goard-ſeeds, one ounce and a half, white Wax as much as is ſufficient, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment to ſmooth the Face after a Burn.
div.p: Take of Pomatum, Oyl of Roſes, each four ounces, ointment of Roſes two ounces, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Pomatum four ounces, Oyl of Roſes three ounces, Citrine ointment half an ounce, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another for Burns and Scalds.
div.p: Take old Lard, and put it upon a red hot iron, then receive the hot drops falling into cold water, and take the fat which ſwims a top, and w •• k it with Roſe-water, and lay it on the Burn.

div.head: Another for a Scald.
div.p: Take of Ceruſſe waſht in Roſe-water, one ounce, Lime waſht in Roſe-water, three drams, the powder of Citrine Ointment half an ounce, the mucilage of the ſeeds of Quinces and Peares extracted with Roſe-water, three ounces, beat them all in a morter to the form of a Liniment.

div.head: An Ointment to take away the marks of the Small-pox in children.
div.p:
Take Oyl of Lillies one pint, Fat four ounces, Oyl of Roſes one ounce, waſh them a good-while with the water of Roſes and Lillies, then take four whites of Eggs, prepare them in their ſhells, and coagulare them a little by the fire, then mix them in a morter with the former, then add of ſweet and bitter Almonds blanched, each one ounce, then beat and incorporate them with the former, and adde the roots of Reeds two drams and a half; Sarcocol, Melon-ſeeds cleanſed, Litharge
of Gold, Sugar, Marrow, Aniſe, Chalk, each one dram, mix them all in a morter to the form of a Liniment.

div.head: Of Ointments for Scabs.
div.p: Take of live Sulphur half a pound, as much Salt, Hogs-greaſe two pound, Oyl of Bays half a pint, mix them.

div.head: Another more powerful for the Scab and ſalt Fleag • .
div.p: Take of Litharge, yellow Arſnick, Quickſilver, Tartar, Maſtick, Olibanum, live Sulphur, each half an ounce, old Hogs-greaſe ſix ounces, Oyl of Bays two ounce, a little Vineger, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another free from all danger.
div.p: Take of Turpentine waſht in Roſe-water, three drams, Oyl of Roſes four ounces, Juice of Orenges, a ſufficient quantity, three yelks of Eggs, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of freſh Butter ſix drams, Jaſmine, Alume, common Salt, each two drams, the Juice of ſowre Dock, of Fumitory, each half an ounce, three yelks of Eggs, powder of Orrice two drams, liquid Styrax ſix drams, mix them.

div.head: Another approved one againſt any Scab, Ringworm, or Tetter.
div.p: Take of Litharge, Alume, Quickſilver, each half a dram, Roſes, Ceruſſe, Savine, the fiſh Sepia, Cadmian earth, each one dram; the aſhes of Maſtick-tree, Calamint, each half a dram, mix them with Juice of Mint, and boyl them with Oyl of Roſes to a third part, adding a little Wax.

div.head: Another for Scabs in children.
div.p: Take of waſht Turpentine, one ounce, the yelk of an Egg, Oyl of Flax, one ounce and a half, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of waſht Butter two ounces, waſht Turpentine three ounces, Salt, yelks of Eggs, Oyl of Roſes, each one ounce, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of freſh Butter waſht with Fumitory-water, waſht Turpentine, common Salt, each three ounces, two yelks of Eggs, Juice of orenges as much as is ſufficient, mix them.

div.head: Of Ointments that beautifie the face.
To make the Face bright.
div.p:
TAke Oyl of Tartar three ounces, ſeeds of Fleawort one ounce, infuſe them in
the mucilage, mix and diſſolve with them in an ounce of Oyl of Roſes, Borax, ſalt Gem, each one dram, and make a Liniment.

div.head: A Colouring for the Face.
div.p: Take of Citrine Ointment freſh made three ounces, ſweet Almonds very well bruiſed, flour of Beans, each one dram, the bone of the fiſh Sepia, Harts-horn, Barley flour, each two drams, incorporate them all with Honey.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Sea-frogs without their ſhell, put them in a glaſs veſſel, and ſprinkle them with the pouder of ſalt Gem, and cover them with Lemmon-water, and ſet them ſo long in the ſun till they become like an Ointment, with which anoint the face, afterwards waſh it with Bean-flower water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Citrine Ointment four ounces, Pomatum two ounces, mix and anoint night and morn, then waſh with Bean-flower water.

div.head: A Liniment after the manner of Virgins milk, to adorn the Face.
div.p:
Take of Litharge of Gold two ounces, boyl it in a little leaden veſſel, with ſix ounces of white wine vineger diſtilled, ſtirring
it all the while with a ſtick, ſtrein it through a linnen cloth, and keep the water; at laſt take of Salt, or Oyl, or Tartar, one ounce, and diſſolve it in a glaſs with four ounces of Water of Lillies, then take in your hand three or four drops of each of the aforeſaid waters, and they will turn to a Virgins milk, with which rub the face, and let it dry in.

div.head: An Ointment to illuſtrate the face.
div.p: Take the Oyl of the Marrow of a Hart, two ounces, Oyl of Goard-ſeeds one ounce, Goats far, waſht Turpentine, each half an ounce, new Wax three drams, melt them by the fire, then adde Maſtick, Borax burnt, each two drams, mix them and make an Unguent, with which anoint the face at night, and in the morning waſh it with Branwater.

div.head: To whiten the face.
div.p: Take of Virgins milk two ounces, Oyl of Tartar one ounce, mix them and anoint the face at night going to ſleep, in the morning waſh it, and it will be clear, bright and fair.

div.head: Of Ointments to whiten the hands.
div.p:
Take of ſalt Lard bruiſed and ſteeped in a Lye three days, (changing the Lye twice a
day) a ſufficient quantity, white Wax a little, white Lilly-roots roaſted under the aſhes and bruiſed, two; melt them by the fire, then paſs it through a thin ſearſe, into cold water, waſh it well, changing the water five or ſix times, afterwards keep it in a glaſs veſſel for your uſe.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Goats far or ſuer cleanſed, and ſteeped in Roſe-water two dayes, and very well waſht, a ſufficient quantity, bruiſe it in a morter, continually waſhing it with Roſe-water, then add white Wax, Musk, Sivet, each as much as ſufficient melt them together, and diffuſe it in Roſe-water, or ſome other ſweet water, then keep it for your uſe.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of bitter Almonds well waſht in Roſe- or Violet-water, a ſufficient quantity, white Wax enough, mix them by the fire, and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Melon and Goard-ſeeds cleanſed, Pine-nuts cleanſed, Peach-kernels, Barleyflour, each one part, bruiſe them all well, then with one pint of Honey, mix them to the form of an Unguent, with which anoint the hands at night, and waſh in the morn.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of ſweet Almonds well waſht, white Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, Camphure one dram, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the root of white Orrice one ounce, Lilly-roots three ounces, white Sugar one ounce, bruiſe them all well, and make them up to the form of a paſte, with which rub the hands, then waſh them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Tartar, Oyl of ſweet Almonds, white Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, diſſolve them by the fire, and adde Myrrhe pouder'd, one dram, Maſtick bruiſed two drams, mix and infuſe them in Roſe-water, waſh them, and then adde Musk, Ambergreece, Camphure, each a little, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ſeeds of Goards, Melons husked, Pine-nuts cleanſed, Peach-Kernels, each ſix ounces, Barley-bran a ſufficient quantity, pouder them and mix them with the beſt Honey.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Pine-nuts cleanſed and bruiſed,
one pound, Muſtard-ſeed one ounce, Fige three ounces, Camphure two drams, beat them all well and mix them, and make a paſte to rub the hands.

div.head: An Ointment to make the hands fair.
div.p: Take of common Oyl waſht, freſh Butter waſht, Goats fat waſht, each one part, ſteep them together four and twenty houres in Roſe-water, then diſſolve them by the fire, and adde white Wax a ſufficient quantity, a little Musk, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the crum of Bread, Rice, red Vetches, each three ounces or four, ſoft Soap an ounce and a half, ſcum'd Honey a ſufficient quantity, make a paſte.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Juice of Pompions a ſufficient quantity, bitter Almonds infuſed in Whey, as much as is ſufficient, a hundred Figs infuſed in the ſame, Muſtard-ſeed two ounces, Orrice-roots one ounce, Ox Gaul five drams, incorporate them and make a paſte.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take a pint of water in an earthen veſſel, leaded and well covered, and boyl half away, then adde Juice of Lemmons ſix ounces, Honey,
Oyl of bitter Almonds, each two ounces, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for hands ſwelled with cold.
div.p: Take the greaſe of Wooll, Gooſe, and Ducks greaſe, the mucilage of Quince-ſeeds, each two ounces, Starch-corn ſix drams, Turpentine one ounce and a half, Oyl of Roſes, Oyl of yelks of Eggs, each two ounces, yellow Wax a little, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another to waſh the hands.
div.p: Take of Pine-nuts cleanſed, powder of Muſtard-ſeed, each three ounces, the beſt Honey half a pint, mix them and make a paſte.

div.head: Another for hands ſwelled with cold.
div.p: Take the ſeeds of Flax, Fenigreek, Marſhmallows, each half a dram, of Mucilage extracted of Lilly-water, and the fore-mentioned ointment, each one ounce, oyl of Dill, oyl of ſweet Almonds, each half an ounce, make a Liniment for the hands with courſe Wooll.

div.head: For Clefts of the hands.
div.p: Take ointment of Litharge, of Ceruſſe, each one dram, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Rams-greaſe, Starch-corn, Litharge,
Oyl, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Litharge of Silver, Myrrhe, Ginger, each a like parts; Honey, Wax, Oyl, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another for clefts of the Hands and cold.
div.p: Take of common Oyl four ounces, white Frankincenſe, clean Wax, each one ounce, the Juice of Elder-leaves three ounces, well ſcented white wine four ounces, boyl an Apple in the Wine, Oyl and Juice of Elder, afterwards adde the Frankincenſe and Wax, and then ſtrein it.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Anoint them with the roots of ſoure Dock and Sows-greaſe.

div.head: Another for the clefts of the hands.
div.p: Take of Maſtick, Oyl of Roſes, white Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Bran burnt to aſhes, the hairs of a Horſe tail burnt, each one part, Honey as much as is ſufficient, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Tutty, Ceruſſe, Litharge, each half a dram, Arſnick, Sublimate three granes,
Lead, Alume, each half a ſcruple, Water of Roſes, Plantane, Purſlane, each a ſufficient quantity, the white of one Egg, make a mixture.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Tragacanth one ſcruple, flour of Starch-corn half an ounce, Juice of Plantane two drams, with Syrup of Roſes make a mixture.

div.head: An Ointment for ſcabby and leprous Nails.
div.p: Take of Rams fat, Colophony, each two drams, mix them.

div.head: A Cerot for the ſame.
div.p: Take of Turpentine, Cummin, each one dram, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Maſtick, unripe Olives, each two ounces, Cynamon one dram, Ceruſſe waſht, burnt Lead, each half a dram, Tutty prepared ſix drams, white Wax, Rozen waſht with wine, each one ounce, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for a contuſion of the nails.
div.p: Take of new Wax, Cummin, Coſtmary, each a ſufficient quantity, pouder them and mix them up with the Wax.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Ducks-greaſe, Bears fat, Euphorbium
pouder'd, each a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: An Ointment for Clefts of the nails.
div.p: Take of Diachylon, Oyl of Almonds, Oyl of Been, Maſtick, Raiſons, each a ſufficient quantity, make a Plaiſter.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Flax-ſeed, Honey, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them to the form of a Plaiſter.

div.head: For leprous Nails.
div.p: Take of Pitch and Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, melt them together, and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Goats Suet, Sandarach pouder'd, each a ſufficient quantity.

div.head: For pill'd Nails.
div.p: Take of Salt, Flour of Barley, Coſtmary powder'd, each one part, Honey a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment after ſhedding of the nails.
div.p: Take of Flax-ſeed one ounce, Cardamoms three drams, Honey a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment to make the nails fall.
div.p: Take ointment of Roſes, Cantharides, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Miſſletoe of the oak, Arſnick, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for warts in the Hands.
div.p: Take the roots of a Vine, ſheeps-dung, and Goats-dung, each one part, the milk of Figs or of Spurge, as much as is ſufficient, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the Lees of Oyl, Sugar-alume, each one ounce, Verdegreaſe two ounces, Tar half an ounce, mix them and uſe them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take ruſt of Braſs, yellow Arſnick, Dates, unſlaked Lime, froth of the Sea, Tartar, Vitriol, Pigeons-dung, the floure of Rie, of Gith, each equal parts, Bulls-gaul, as much as is ſufficient, make an Unguent to lay on the Warts firſt ſcarified.

div.head: Another.
div.p: The bark of Sallow burnt, and mixt with Vinegar, and laid on; alſo a Dogs-turd with Wax.

div.head: Of Ointments that adorn the Breſt.
To keep the Breaſts ſmall.
div.p:
TAke of Roch-alume pouder'd a ſufficient quantity, Oyl of Roſes as much as is
ſufficient, mix them and anoint the breaſt.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Bolearmenick pouder'd, green Gauls bruiſed, each one part, Honey a ſufficient quantity, make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Ceruſſe, white Marble, each one part, Oyl of Myrtels a ſufficient quantity, pouder them and mix them.

div.head: To make the Breſts decreaſe or grow leſs.
div.p: The juice of Hemlock mixt with Camphure and layd on, makes them leſs; alſo white Frankincenſe with Navel-wort and ſharp Vinegar, hinders their growth.

div.head: An Ointment to hinder their growth.
div.p: Take a ſufficient quantity of Dyers-earth, boyl it with Honey, and make a thick Poulteſſe, and apply it from morning to night, then lay over it a Spunge ſoaked in cold water till the Poulteſſe be taken off, and if you would have it more effectual, mix with it ten unripe Gauls, it will make them right and ſtreight.

div.head: To harden ſoft and looſe Breaſts.
div.p:
Take clay, the white of an Egge, unripe, Gauls, Maſtick, Frankincenſe, each a ſufficient quantity, bruiſe them all and mix them with hot Vinegar, and anoint the breaſt,
and ſuffer it to lye on all night; if once will not do, do it again.

div.head: To hinder the growth of the Breaſts.
div.p: Bruiſe Hemlock, and let a Maſs of it with Vineger be laid on a Virgins breaſt, it will ſo confine them that they grow not, though at the time of milk coming in them.

div.head: A Liniment to ſmooth flaggy, wrinckled Breaſts.
div.p: Take Lees of Oyl, as much as is ſufficient, Gum-arabick, Tragacanth, Maſtick, each a little, Camphure a very little, mix them.

div.head: To make the Breaſts leſs and hard.
div.p: Take of green Mint, dryed Roſes, wilde Pears, Medlars, Servaces, Slooes, Juice of binding Bean-tree, Pomegranate-flowers, Pomegranate-rinde, unripe Pine-nuts, Plantane, Flowers of Archangel, each alike parts, bruiſe them and boyl them in Vineger, then adde flour of Beans, as much as is ſufficient, make a Plaiſter.

div.head: Another for the ſame.
div.p:
Take of Quinces, unripe Plums, each a ſufficient quantity, bruiſe them very well, and adde Bolearmenick, Plantane-ſeed, Aniſeſeed, Fennel, Cummin, each a little, Juice
of Plantane, Vineger, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: An Ointment for Breaſts that hang down.
div.p: Take of Bean-flower, Frankincenſe, Maſtick, Juice of Houſleek, hot Vineger, whites of Eggs, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them.

div.head: Another for the ſame.
div.p: Take of dried Figs, Raiſons, Cummin, Vineger, each as much as is ſufficient, bruiſe them and boyl them to the form of a Plaiſter.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Gauls, Maſtick, Frankincenſe, whites of Eggs, hot Vineger, each as much as will ſuffice, mix them: Bran boyled with Vineger and laid on the Breaſts, will do the like.

div.head: An Ointment for Clefts of the Nibbles.
div.p: Take Oyl of Roſes, the middle rinde of Elder, each one ounce, Wax as much as is ſufficient, mix them.

div.head: Another for pain proceeding of Clefts.
div.p:
Take Oyl of Violets, or Oyl of ſweet Almonds, white Frankincenſe, Wax, each
two drams, and then mix them.

div.head: Another for Clefts.
div.p: Take Badgers fat half an ounce, Martialum, and Agrippa's Ointment, Ointment of Marſh • mallowes, and that called Anodyne, each one dram, Oyl of Nard one ounce and a half, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Roſes two ounces, new Wax half an ounce, Litharge, Frankincenſe, each one dram, mix them.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Tragacanth one ſcruple, flour of Starch-corn two ounces, Juice of Plantane three drams, mix them and anoint.

div.head: Ointments to adorn the Belly and Feet.
To take away the Wrinckles of the Belly after Childe bearing.
div.p: TAke of burnt Harts-horn, the ſtone Amiantus, Ammoniack, Salt, Myrrhe, Frankincenſe, M • ſtick, each as much as is ſufficient, pouder and mix them with Honey.

div.head: Another of the ſame.
div.p: Take of Rams Suet, nine times waſht in cold water, one pound, two whites of Egges, a little Butter, bruiſe them all very well, then adde Maſtick, Olibanum, each two drams, mix them and make an Ointment for the Belly.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Sea-onion burnt, burnt Harts-horn, Plumed-Alume, Ammoniack. Salt, Myrrhe, Olibanum, Maſtick, Gith, Barley-flour, each a like parts, pouder and mix them with honey.

div.head: An Ointment for hardneſs of the feet.
div.p: Take the flour of Gith, the flour of old Bread-corn, Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them, and make a Cerot to lay on the place.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Drink made with Vineger and Honey, Ammoniacum, each one ounce Bdellium, Sagapen, each two drams, Turpentine three drams, Oyl of Orrice, two ounces, mix them and make an Unguent.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the aſhes of the rinde of Sallow, Vineger, each as much as will ſuffice, mix them and anoint the place.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the green leaves of Rue, Raifons, each a ſufficient quantity, bruiſe them togegether, and make a Plaiſter.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Galbanum, Wax, each a ſufficient quantity, and mix them.

div.head: A brave-ſcented Ointment.
div.p: Take of Musk, Ambergreece, Sivet, each four granes, with Oyl of ſweet Almonds, reduce them to the form of an Ointment.

div.head: Or thus:
div.p: Take Oyl of Nutmegs made by a Preſs, one dram, the beſt Sivet one ſcruple, choice Musk ſix granes, Oyl of Spike, Lavender, each two or three drops, mix them and make an Ointment to anoint the Noſtrils, Fore-head, and principal parts, to fortifie them.

div.head: A white Sweet-ſmelling Soap.
div.p:
TAke of old Venetian Soap ſcraped, and ſix days ſet in the ſun, as much as is ſufficient,
beat it very well with one pint of the beſt Roſe-water, then diſſolve it by a gentle fire, and adde powder of Orrice four ounces, Starch-corn ſix ounces, white Saunders two ounces, liquid Styrax, Oyl of Spike, each one ounce, mix them very well, and when it is cold, make balls.

div.head: A muskified Soap.
div.p: Take of the beſt Soap ſcraped one pound, choice Cynamon, Nutmeg, Cane, Styrax, each one ounce, wood of Aloes two drams, Benjamin two ounces, Cloves one ounce, beat them all to a fine powder, and adde powder of Cy • erus one dram, Musk, Siver, each a little, dip them in Roſe-water, afterwards ſet them in the ſun for forty days, and make Balls, which muſt be kept in Cotton in woodden veſſels.

div.head: A white ſweet Soap.
div.p:
Take of old common Soap ſcraped, a ſufficient quantity, dry it well for eight dayes or ten, then bruiſe it and ſearſe it, and adde Powder of Orrice four ounces, white Saunders three ounces, Mahaleb two ounces, flour of Starch-corn one omnce, powder them all and mix them, and put them in a
morter together, with one ounce of liquid Styrax, and a little Oyl of Spike, beat them all well together, and at laſt with the Flour of Starch-corn; make Balls, dry them in the ſhade, and keep them for your uſe.

div.head: Another moſt excellent one.
div.p: Take ſix granes of Musk diſſolved in Roſe-water, Sivet four granes, mix them with the fore-mentioned Soap, but the Musk muſt be hot in the Roſe-water.

div.head: Another to whiten the hands.
div.p: Take of bitter Almonds cleanſed and bruiſed one pound, Turky-ſoap the bigneſs of an Egg, Muſtard-ſeed one ſpoonful, pouder them all and mix them.

div.head: Of Powders to adorn the Teeth.
A Powder to make them white.
div.p: TAke of red Co •• al. Date-ſtone Pummyſtone, the bones of the fiſh Sepia, burnt Salt, each a ſufficient quantity, mix them and make a Powder.

div.head: Another to faſten the Teeth, and ſtrengthen the Gums.
div.p: Take of red Corral, Pearl, Dragons blood, Bolearmenick, Frankincenſe, Crabs ſhells, each one part, mix them and make a Powder.

div.head: An excellent Dentifrice.
div.p: Take of Hyſſope, Organy, Mint, each two ounces, cleft Alume, Harts-horn, common Salt, each one dram, take them and burn them in a pot to coales, then adde Pepper, Pummy-ſtone, Pellitory of Spain, Maſtick, each half a dram, Myrrhe, Cynamon, each one ſcruple, make a fine Powder.

div.head: A Powder to whiten the Teeth.
div.p: Take the bones of the fiſh Sepia, white Marble burnt, each one ounce, Cloves, Cynamon, Pellitory of Spain, each three ounces, Spunge, Pummy-ſtone, Salt, each one ounce, mix them and make a fine Powder to rub the Teeth.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Ginger, Cynamon, Cloves, Pummyſtone, wood of Aloes, Nutmeg, Mace, each
half an ounce, Pepper, Pellitory of Spain, Muſtard-ſeed, Staveſacer, each three ounces, Spunge, white Marble, each half an ounce, Date-ſtones burnt white Hellebore, each two ounces, Barley bread burnt with Salt and Honey, half an ounce; red Tyles, burnt Harts-horn, Feather'd-alume, Oliveſtones burnt, Myrobalane-ſtones burnt, each three ounces, mix them and make a fine Powder.

div.head: Of Powders to adorn the Hands,
To make the Hands white.
div.p: TAke the flour of Beans, of Lupines, of Starch-corn, Rice, ſmall Beanes, Orrice, each ſix ounces, mix them and make a Powder, with which waſh the hands in water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Pine-nuts cleanſed and bruiſed two ounces, Muſtard-ſeed one pound, Almonds cleanſed and bruiſed two ounces; make a Powder and dry it in the ſun, with which rub the hands with the Juice of Lemmons, and then with water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take the ſeeds of Rocket ſix ounces, Orrice, Cummin, each one ounce, dregs of Alume half an ounce, Sugar-candy, Tragacanth, each one ounce, Camphure one ſcruple, Pine-nuts, Almonds cleanſed three ounces, the crum of white bread half an ounce, old Soap ſcraped two ounces, pouder them all and mix them, and make a Powder to waſh the hands.

div.head: A Dentifrice to whiten the Teeth.
div.p: Take of Roſemary, Mint, Pennyroyal, each half a dram, Orrice-roots, Cammelshay, each one ſcruple; Nard, Pepper, each half a ſcruple, Pummy-ſtone, burnt Salt, Harts-horn, each two ſcruples, make them up with Tragacanth ſteeped in Roſe-water. Sticks of the Maſtick-tree may be found fit to cleanſe and ſtrengthen the teeth.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of red Corral one ounce, Majorican earth half an ounce, the bones of the fiſh Sepia, Pummy-ſtone, each two drams; Cloves, Cynamon, Maſtick, each one ſcruple, choice Pearl one dram, Dragons blood two drams, Musk one grane, pouder them
and work them into a maſs with Tragacanth ſteeped in Roſe-water; of which make Dentifrices like penſils.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Harts-horn, a Horſes teeth, each two ounces, Sea-ſhells, common Salt, Cypreſs nuts, each one ounce, burn them together in an Oven, and make a Powder, to be wrought up with the mucilage of Gumtragacanth.

div.head: Another in Powder.
div.p: Take of Myrrhe, Maſtick, Frankincenſe, each half an ounce, Harts-horn burnt and waſht, red Corral, Roſes, Musky-Saunders, Cloves, each two ſcruples, the bone of the fiſh Sepia, Roche-alume burnt, each two drams, Pummy-ſtone one dram and a half, common Salt burnt one dram, make a Powder; you may uſe it with a Mallowroot prepared.

div.head: Another eminent one.
div.p:
Take the tops of Myrtle, of Maſtick-tree, Wilde-Olive, Sage, Roſemary, each one handful; red Corral, Ivory, Horſes-teeth, each half an ounce, common Salt
one pugil, burn them together in an earthen veſſel till they be white, then pouder them and adde of Cloves, Roſes, thick Cynamon, each three ounces, mix them and rub the Teeth, or with the Cremor of Tragacanth make long Penſils.

div.head: A ſweet Bag.
div.p: TAke of Cubebs half a dram, Cloves one ſcruple, Gith burnt one ounce and a half, Mace two ſcruples, pouder them and put them into ſilk.

div.head: A Violet Powder.
div.p: Take Orrice of Florence half a pound, Roſes four ounces. Cyperus half an ounce, Marjoram, Cloves, each half a dram; ſweet-ſcented white Saunders, Benjamin, each four ounces, Styrax-calamite one ounce, pouder them and put them in ſilk for a ſcent.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take Florentine Flower-de-luce four pound, dried Marjoram one fourth, Calamus-Aromaticus three ounces, Roſes,
Violets, each five drams; Cloves half an ounce, Musk one dram, pouder them and put them in ſilk.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Orrice of Florence two pound, red Roſes one pound, Styrax-calamite, Cloves, white Saunders, Aromatick, Cane, Coriander, Cyperus, each four ounces; Marjoram, Lavender, each ſix drams; Sivet, Musk, each a ſufficient quantity, then mix them.

div.head: A Pomander.
div.p: Take of Styrax-calamita one ounce, Cloves two drams, Benjamin half an ounce, Ambergreece half a dram, Musk fifteen granes, of the aforeſaid Violet-powder a ſufficient quantity, Roſe-water as much as will make it up.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Styrax-calamita one ounce and a half, Benjamin two ounces, Labdanum half an ounce, Cloves, white Saunders, each three drams; Roſes, Marjoram, each two drams and a half; Musk, Ambergreece, each one ſcruple; make a Pomander
with the infuſion of Gum-tragacanth in Roſe-water.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Styrax-calamite, liquid Styrax, Benjamin, Gallia Moſchata, Alipta Moſchata, Labdanum, each one ounce, choice Cynamon, Cloves, white Saunders, each half an ounce, red Roſes, Nutmeg, Mace, Wood of Aloes, Cardamoms, Marjoram, Gum-Elemni, Gith-ſeed, Zedoary, each a dram and a half, Turpentine as much as is ſufficient, with a little infuſion of Tragacanth made in Roſe-water, then make a maſs.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of yellow Saunders ſix drams two ſcruples, Wood of Aloes half an ounce, red Roſes, Baſilicon, Lavender, Roſemary-flowers, Marjoram, each three drams one ſcruple, Citron-pill ſeven drams; Cynamon, Nutmeg, Mace, Cloves, Corianderſeed prepared, Cardamoms, each three drams one ſcruple; pure Labdanum eight ounces, Styrax-calamita ſix drams two ſcruples, liquid Styrax three ounces, Benjamin ten drams, yellow Wax one ounce and a
half, Turpentine four ounces, Roſe-water two ounces and a half, Musk of Alexandria, Ambergreece, each two ſcruples and a half, make a maſs.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Powder of Violets a dram and a half, Roſes, Marjoram, Styrax-calamite, Labdanum, each one dram, Cloves two drams, Benjamin, Nutmegs, each one ſcruple; Ambergreece half a ſcruple, make a maſs with Roſe-water, in which Tragacanth and Gumarabick have been ſteeped, and ſprinkle it with a little Oyl, either of Cynamon, or Cloves, or Nutmegs.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Styrax three drams, Cloves, Cynamon, each two drams, Mace, Nutmeg, each one dram, Wood of Aloes half a dram, Musk, Ambergreece, each three granes, Maſtick one dram and a half, pouder and ſearſe them, then make them up with the diſtilled Water of Marjoram, and liquid Styrax, and make round ſweet Balls.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take of Virgins Wax four ounces, Oyl of Olives, Turpentine, each half an ounce, Labdanum three drams, Olibanum, Maſtick, each a dram and a half, Myrrhe, Styrax-calamite, each two drams, white and red Been, red Roſes, dried Mint, Marjoram, Cloves, Cardamoms, white and red Saunders, Cynamon, Nutmeg, Wood of Aloes, Camphure, each one dram, Ambergreece, Musk, each half a dram, pouder them and make a Pomander.

div.head: A Pomander for the time of Peſtilence.
div.p: Take of Labdanum, Styrax-calamite, each one dram, Cloves half a dram, Camphure, Nard, Nutmeg, each ſeven granes, bruiſe them all to a fine pouder, and mix them with Roſe-water in which Tragacanth and Gumarabick have been ſteeped, and make Balls.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Labdanum three ounces, Styrax-calamite one ounce, Benjamin half an ounce, Cloves three drams, red Roſes two drams, Wood of Aloes, white Saunders, each one dram, Majoram, Lavender, Gith-ſeeds, each half a dram, Camphure three granes, liquid Styrax half an ounce,
with the infuſion of Gum-tragacanth in Roſe-water make a Pomander, the rich may adde a little Musk and Ambergreece.

div.head: A Pomander that will purge.
div.p: Take of Scammony, Aloes, Myrrhe, each one dram, Spurge, Coloquintida, each one dram and a half, powder and ſearſe them, and with the Juice of Coriander make two Pomanders; which hold in your hands, often changing them from one hand into the other, that they may be hot and alter the air.

div.head: Another againſt the Plague.
div.p: Take the Flowers of Water-lillies, Bugloſs, Violers, Roſes, each one dram, Pomecitron rinde one dram and a half, Mace half a dram, all the Saunders, each a dram and a half, white Poppy one ſcruple, Camphure half a ſcruple, Labdanum two drams, Ambe regreece four granes, powder them and make them up with the diſtilled Water of Lettice and liquid Styrax, and make ſweet Balls.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
Take of Styrax-calamita, Benjamin,
eace one ounce, Labdanum, Maſtick, each half an ounce, Cloves, Wood of Aloes, yellow Saunders, each one dram; Gith-ſeeds two drams, with a little Venice-Turpentine, make ſweet balls, and aromatize them with a little Musk, and Amber-greece diſſolved in Oyl of Cloves.

div.head: A ſweet Ointment.
div.p: Take of Musk, Ambergreece, Sivet, each four granes, Oyl of ſweet Almonds, as much as is ſufficient, make a Liniment.

div.head: Another.
div.p: Take Oyl of Nurmeg made by a preſs, one dram, the beſt Sivet one ſcruple, choice Musk ſix granes, Oyl of Spike, Oyl of Lavender, each two drops or three, make an Ointment, to anoint the forehead, noſtrils, and other principal parts.

div.head: A Candle for a Perfume.
div.p:
Take of ſweet Aſa, Styrax-calamita, each four ounces, red Styrax, Olibanum, each twelve ounces, Labdanum eighteen ounces, Cloves one ounce and a half, Gith one ounce, Coriander prepared, Juniper-berries, each half an ounce, liquid Styrax ſix-ounces,
Turpentine half an ounce, Coales of Linetree or Sallow, thirty ounces, with the infuſion of Gum-tragacanth made in Roſe-water, make Candles.

div.head: Perfuming Candles againſt Poyſon and Peſtilence.
div.p: Take of Labdanum three ounce, Styraxcalamita ten drams, ſweet Aſa ſix drams, Frankincenſe one ounce and a half, French Lavender two ounces, red Roſes, Cloves, each three ounces, Pomecitron-pills, yellow Saunders, each two drams, Juniper-berries half an ounce, Amber-greece, Musk, each half a ſcruple, Coals of Line-tree one pound and a half, mix them all with Gum-tragacanth and Roſe-water warm, and bring them into a Maſſe, then make ſmall Candles out of it, and dry them gently.

div.head: A Muskified Soap.
div.p: Take of Venetian Soap four pound, cut it very ſmall, and add pouder of Cloves, white Saunders, each two ounces, Benjamin one ounce, Musk twenty granes, temper them with Roſe-water, ſome add a few drops of Oyl of Spike, but Oyl of Cloves or Mace will do better.

div.head: Balls againſt the Plague or Peſtilence.
div.p: Take of Labdanum three drams, powder of Roſes, Aromatick-cane, Orrice, the true Dittander, Angelica, Cynamon, ſweet Saunders, Nutmegs, each two ſcruples, Benjamin, two drams and a half, Amber-greece one ſcruple, Musk twenty granes, Styrax-calamita, half an ounce, with ſix ounces of Gum-Arabick or Tragacanth, infuſed in one ounce of Roſe-water, make Balls according to Art, and anoint them with Oyl of Benjamin.

div.head: Troches for Perfumes.
div.p: TAke Wood of Aloes, Labdanum, Benjamin, each two drams, Styrax-calamite half a dram, Sugar-candy three ounces, Musk two granes, mix them with Roſe-water into a Paiſte, and make Troches, which will ſmell the better if you ſprinkle a little Roſe-water on them when you uſe them.

div.head: Troches of Gallia Moſchata.
div.p: Take raw Wood of Aloes, choice and good, five parts, Ambergreece three parts, good Musk one part, Mucilage of Tragacanth diſſolved in Roſe-water, as much as will ſuffice to make them up, and make Troches of the figure of a Myrtle-leaf, ſeal them up, and put them in an Earthen Veſſel.

div.head: Troches of Benjamin.
div.p: Take of Benjamin ſix ounces, Wood of Aloes eight ounces, Styrax-calamite three ounces, Musk half a dram, Orrice two ounces, Sugar-candy three pound, powder them, and with Roſe-water make Troches.

div.head: The Counteſs of Arnsburg's Perfume.
div.p:
Take freſh white Roſes bruiſed four ounces, Benjamin ſteeped in Roſe-water a day and a night, two ounces; Ambergreece three granes, Musk two granes, Siver one grane, powder and beat them with the Roſes, then adde of the beſt Sugar
half an ounce, then let them alone in a morter, well covered for two dayes, then work them into a maſs, and make Troches; but you muſt mix a little Gumtragacanth ſteeped in Roſe-water, and Gumdragon to make them ſtick together the better.

div.head: A Perfume made in the form of little Birds.
div.p: Take of red Styrax half a pound, liquid Styrax one ounce, Styrax-calamite one ounce and a half, coals of Sallow, Tragacanth, each two drams; let the powder of the Coals and the Tragacanth be ſteeped three days in Roſe-water, then work them into a maſs, of which make the figures of Birds.

div.head: An excellent Perfume for Candles or Troches.
div.p:
Take of ſweet Aſa half an ounce, Powder of Orrice two drams, Wood of Aloes, Nutmeg, Cloves, Maſtick, each one dram, Styrax-calamite two drams, all the Saunders, each half a ſcruple, Camphure five
granes, Ambergreece, Musk, each four granes, white Sugar four ounces, with the mucilage of Tragacanth and a little liquid Styrax and Roſe-water with Musk, make Candles or Troches.

p.hi: IT teacheth to make variety of ſweet Waters, for the Body or Garments, to illuſtrate and adorn the face, to take away Freckles, Skars, Sun-burns, Pimples, Redneſs; with the Art of making ſeveral Colourings or Fucuſſes, alſo how to take away Spots, Bunchings, Warts; to kill Ring worms, to ſmooth Wrinkles, raze out the marks of the ſmall Pox; with Potions to make the Body fat or lean, ſweet Baths to cleanſe the body, alſo how to colour the Hair of any colour whatſoever, to make it grow thick, to make it curl, to lengthen it, to cauſe it to grow where it is wanting, and take it away where it is ſuperfluous, to hinder the ſhedding of it; alſo to cure all blemiſhes or infirmities of the eyes and teeth, with Dentrifrices and Powders to cleanſe and whiten them: to make Lotions, Lyes, and Ointments; As alſo to cure ſore Heads, Dander, Nits, Lice, Scabs, Scars, Leproſies, Tetters, Scalds and Burns; to whiten the hands, to take away all deformities of womens breaſts: how to make ſweet and muskified Soaps to waſh with; alſo Perfumes, ſweet Bags, Pomanders for delight, and thoſe that will purge by ſmelling to them, Candles that perfume as they burn, and ſeveral Troches for Perfumes.
